description: a(n) = |{m : multiplicative order of 2 mod m = n}|.
comments: The multiplicative order of a mod m, GCD(a,m)=1, is the smallest natural number d for which a^d = 1 (mod m). See A002326.a(n) is odd iff n is squarefree, A005117. - _Thomas Ordowski_, Jan 18 2014
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
formula: a(n) = 1 iff 2^n-1 is noncomposite. a(prime(n)) = 2^A088863(n)-1. - _Thomas Ordowski_, Jan 16 2014
maple: with(numtheory):a:= n-> add(mobius(n/d)*tau(2^d-1), d=divisors(n)):seq(a(n), n=1..100);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, May 31 2012
mathematica: a[n_] := Sum[ MoebiusMu[n/d] * DivisorSigma[0, 2^d - 1], {d, Divisors[n]}]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 71} ] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 12 2012 *)
crossrefs: Column k=2 of A212957. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 12 2012
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 04 2001
extensions: More terms from _John W. Layman_, Mar 22 2002
More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, May 31 2012
